item.title: How I run emacs in client/server mode under macOS
item.description: There are many articles you can find about running Emacs in client/server mode. However, when I tried to do it on my particular environment (macOS 11.0.1 Big Sur, using zsh), some tweaks were still needed. So, I decided to describe my setup. In macOS, the Emacs executable is /Applications/Emacs.app/Contents/MacOS/Emacs. To run Emacs in its non-server mode of operation, I defined two shell commands in .zshrc: emacs runs Emacs in its own macOS window, whereas emacsnw runs Emacs within the terminal.
